intro: Hieracium miramarense, commonly known as the Miramar hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Uruguay. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are basal, rough, and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
